The whole series of them were there, the butler, Khansamah, with bland, suave visage, every feature breathing consciousness of his importance, and a subdued melancholy in his eyes, telling that he might, an if he would, disclose strange things about his occidental masters; then the bearer, so called, perhaps, because he has to bear much besides the clothes and boots that are the rightful objects of his attention; then the Khidmatgar, the cook, the deputy cook, the syces, and the whole throng of them that live so well and work so badly.
